skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Greatest of all the bear mounts, the 'Bear-brother' who awaits his legendary rider, Boris Bokha.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Boris' return heralds a period of unprecedented growth among the Kislevites, proving his intrinsic connection to the Motherland and its people.
"You've got to lose yourself before you find yourself, back in exileâ€¦"
Following centuries of devastating conflict against Ruin, the cities of Kislev shall rise again, stronger than ever before.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -50% for Garrison and Religion buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Ursus the Red, the greatest of Kislev's rulers, commands respect from those wishing to treat with the frozen kingdom for common cause.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Boris' every heartbeat echoes with the courage and tenacity of Ursun.
Hold tight to duty and rid the mind of all fear, for fear is a threat to the Motherland.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Every enemy has the right to bear arms. And the right to be horrifically mauled by bear-teeth.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +16% for War Bear Riders and Elemental Bear units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "I don't know what effect these men will have upon the enemy, but by Ursun, they frighten me."

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Tzar Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Tzar Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All that was lost to Chaos shall be reclaimed, in Ursun's name for the good of all Kislev.
The Great Bear shall be reborn, and the Motherland with him.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Regeneration" for Elemental Bear units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: The thunderous pounding of Kislevite hooves can be heard for leagues around, even muffled by the crunch of fresh snow.

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Tzar Boris Bokha is a fierce warrior and devout follower of the Bear God, Ursun.

items.colour_text: Its blade crafted from the Norscan glaciers and magically bound to remain forever frozen, when this mighty polearm strikes, the foeâ€™s blood turns to ice.

item_set.name: The Red Tzar's Attire
item_set.description: Boris returns, and so he will need his cloak and blade once more.

items.colour_text: This suit of ancient scale carries with it the blessing of the Bear-God, allowing the wearer to shrug off blows that would fell an ox and fortifying their strength.

item_set.name: The Red Tzar's Attire
item_set.description: Boris returns, and so he will need his cloak and blade once more.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Ursun called to me, and even in the coldest of sleeps, I answered!"
